sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>old</radical> <radical>winter</radical> is to blame for today's <kanji>circumstance</kanji>. It is the <kanji>reason</kanji> things are bad now.
meaningInfo: Imagine a poor, broken town. And, imagine the mayor of a town telling their people that things are bad because of that bad old winter. "It's to blame for our circumstance!" he yells.
readingMnemonic: In reality, this <kanji>circumstance</kanji> was actually caused by a single <ja><reading>子</reading></ja> (<ja>こ</ja>), though. This kid went through town, destroying everything in their path.
readingInfo: Imagine your kid character walking through town, using their super powers to destroy buildings and rot food.
